intro: Weingartia roberto-vasquezii, commonly known as the Roberto Vásquez cactus, is a species of flowering cactus native to Mexico. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in dense, white spines. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-draining soil and full sunlight. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable addition to succulent collections.
